intro: Swertia diluta var. diluta, commonly known as the Himalayan gentian, is a herbaceous plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Gentianaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving at elevations between 2,000 and 4,500 meters. Its leaves are lanceolate and arranged alternately along the stem, while the flowers are tubular with five lobes. Swertia diluta var. diluta is known for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
